questions.question: What happens when Roger tries to steal Mrs. Jones purse in Thank you Ma'm

choices.answer: He changes his mind because he knows stealing is wrong
He changes his mind since he's frightened by her large size
The purse is so heavy that he loses his balance and falls
He runs away is caught by a person and taken to Mrs. Jones

questions.question: "The large woman simply turned around and kicked him right in his blue jean sitter." She is:

choices.answer: confused
scared
angry
sad

questions.question: In “Thank You, M'am,” how does Mrs. Jones get Roger to her home?

choices.answer: She drags him up the street
She asks the person who caught Roger to drop off the boy
She promises Roger food
She says he can have blue suede shoes if he comes with her

questions.question: Why is Roger scared in Mrs. Jones's home?

choices.answer: He's very hungry
He says is a very strong woman
Mrs. Jones talks so fast he can't understand her
He fears that Mrs. Jones will turn him over to the police

questions.question: Why does Roger try to steal the purse

choices.answer: To try to get money for food
To get back at Mrs. Jones for stealing from his father
To get money for new suede shoes
To show he is tough

questions.question: How does Mrs Jones show she trust Roger

choices.answer: She makes him wash his face
she makes sure roomers keep their doors open
She leaves her purse near him when she prepares food
She tells him her full name

questions.question: Which idea does the theme deal with

choices.answer: The value of kindness
The value of hard work
The value of a dollar
The value of city life

questions.question: How might a reader state the theme of "Thank you Ma'm"

choices.answer: Children should respect their elders
A child needs attention from an adult
Do not try to steal in your own backyard
The city streets are dangerous at night

questions.question: What does barren mean in this sentence? The surface of the moon is dark and barren.

choices.answer: Distant
Empty
Frightening
full of life

questions.question: Which place would best be described as barren?

choices.answer: a lush garden in summer
an empty beach in winter
a dirty, crowded subway car
a football field during an exciting play

questions.question: For which activity would you most want to look presentable

choices.answer: going to sleep
hanging out at a friends house
cleaning the garage
going to a job interview

questions.question: Why does Roger lose his balance when he tries to steal Mrs. Jones's purse

choices.answer: Mrs. Jones kicks him
Mrs. Jones is very large
The purse is very heavy
roger is weighted down by guilt

questions.question: what is Mrs Jones 1st reaction to Rogers attempt to steal her purse

choices.answer: puzzled
frightened
angry
she is deeply hurt

questions.question: what does Mrs. Jones do when Roger struggles to get away

choices.answer: she jerks him in front of her wrestles him & drags him
Hits him over the head with her purse and kicks him
she shouts very loudly for help frightening the boy to stay
she warns him that she will call the police

questions.question: What can you infer from reading that Roger has no one home to wash his face

choices.answer: Shy
neglected at home
trouble telling the truth
good sense of humor

questions.question: According to Mrs. Jones in “Thank You, M'am,” what lesson has Roger not been taught?

choices.answer: why “early to bed and early to rise” is true
how to apologize
how to steal a purse without getting caught
the difference between right and wrong

questions.question: When Mrs. Jones brings Roger home, what does he first fear she will do?

choices.answer: poison him with the food she serves
hit him over the head again
bore him to death with her stories
turn him in to the police

questions.question: why does Roger sit on the far side of the room when Mrs. Jones goes behind the screen?

choices.answer: He is frightened that she is calling the police
He does not want to smell the food she is cooking
He wants her to see that he is not taking from her purse
He wants to be where she cannot see him take money from her

questions.question: How does Mrs. Jones admission that she did bad things when young reveal the theme of the story?

choices.answer: She brags about her youthful adventures so he will be humble
she is older and lonely and needs to confide in somebody
She wants to be the adult whom Rogers trust
She wants to prove to Roger that teenagers are delinquent

questions.question: The author calls Mrs. Jones large what might large apply to besides her size

choices.answer: amount of money
A number of friends
Her large Heart
Her large Temper

questions.question: what does Mrs. Jones mean by:  “shoes come by devilishlike that will burn your feet”

choices.answer: The devil wears hot shoes
People who buy shoes with stolen money often go to jail
Shoes that do not fit will pinch your toes
Get shoes with stolen money, and guilt will burn your feet

questions.question: Which statement is a main theme of “Thank You, M'am”

choices.answer: Older people seek company even from those who harm them
Kindness and goodwill are stronger than fear and mistrust
If you are going to steal, do not get caught
City streets are full of dangers for young and old alike

questions.question: In which sentence is presentable used correctly

choices.answer: The past is over, so it is time to focus on the presentable
I wore my oldest shirt to be presentable
the gifts were piled high on the presentable table
I combed my hair to look more presentable

questions.question: Which sentence would come first in a story about a lion and a woman at the circus

choices.answer: The lion has roared for hours
The woman had entered the tent with a lion
I have never enjoyed a circus more
The circus will have departed by tomorrow
